S.K. Thompson on Virginia State Troopers Complaint–Police officers have too much power and get away with breaking laws! Privacy Policy What car insurance company is the best? Progressive? Geico? Nationwide? Read on to find out! By Allard T. So who really has the best car insurance at the best price with the best customer service? Progressive!
If you’re like most people this recession has hit you hard in the pocketbook and seriously cramped your finances. So you’re looking to save money anywhere you can. I don’t blame you. I am doing the exact same thing myself everyday. At one place that we can all save money on is car insurance.
But the first thing you have to ask yourself is this–is the lowest price the best deal? As with many things in life the lowest rate car insurance may not be the best deal out there and it may also not offer you the best coverage or customer service. Customer service with car insurance is a really big deal.
Who wants a car insurance company that you can’t get a hold of when you need them. Or how about one that drops you for no reason and with no warning. Or one that just decides to raise your rates constantly so when you thought your Ridgely getting a great deal you soon no longer are and then you end up paying far more in the end.
Shopping around is the best way to get the best deal on car insurance. Don’t listen to the TV as for Nationwide, Allstate and Geico were they say they save money when you switch to their car insurance from the others. What they are doing is kind of like false advertising because maybe Geico offers a better rate well for a Ford Mustang GT 2000, whereas Allstate offers a better rate for the convertible and Geico has a better rate for the V6 coupe.
You have to actually go and get a quote whether it be through the phone or in person from each of these companies and then compare them. What you will find nine times out of 10 is that usually none of these is the lowest or the best coverage. I have been around for a long time and every year I call all the insurance companies to see who has the best rates and the best coverage for my vehicles.
Your Ad Here
The funny thing is that every year I do it I come up with the exact same answer–Progressive always beats out the others by several hundred dollars or even more. Now the next thing you want to look at is customer service. Nationwide, Allstate and State Farm representatives, in my book, have a lot to learn about customer service.
These independent insurance agents think that once you sign with them that you are locked in for life and treat you like dirt. I was insured with Nationwide Insurance for several years until I found that for the same exact vehicle Progressive was $1,600 less per year! That’s a pretty substantial savings in car insurance!
I did not have any points on my record and didn’t have any accidents. I always paid every payment on time and was a great customer. I have to say was because as soon as I found that out I switched to Progressive. I then found that progressive actually treated me far better. If I have to call them about something they don’t put me on hold or treat me like dirt.
I have dealt with Nationwide, All State, State Farm, Geico and Progressive and out of all these car insurance companies the best by far was progressive. In one instance Geico did offer a slightly better deal that was $150 less per year in insurance. It apparently just is that they had a lower rate on a van I used to have. GEICO is not bad either, they just tend to be a tad bit more expensive than Progressive.
But I will say this, both Geico and Progressive have far better customer service than all the other car insurance companies put together.
